text.sentence: Healthcare | U.S. Health Care Managed Care thirty one July two thousand fifteen
We see little evidence of any meaningful changes from previous expectations and in fact would suggest that the underlying metrics and quality of the quarter appear relatively strong.
We would suggest that core earnings were slightly above expectations and certain one time positives pushed the results further above our estimates.

One clear area of focus is medical loss ratios and the ratios for both commercial and government segments were down more than one hundredbps from the prior year, a welcome reversal of the pressure seen last quarter.
As noted last week, guidance is moving up another dollar .ten
dollar .fifteen per share to a new range of dollar eight.thirty
dollar eight.sixty per share, with the midpoint of dollar eight.forty
The boost appears to be driven by mostly by favorable development in the healthcare segment.
In terms of the actual second quarter of two thousand fifteen, Cigna reported a strong second quarter that was augmented by certain favorable items, and backed by solid quality metrics.
Cigna reported adjusted earnings per share that were safely above our estimates, and the street consensus .
The upside was driven mainly by the healthcare segment which included some favorable development with the other segments also coming in slightly favorable to our estimates.
The commercial MLR trend was down one hundred fortybps, and the government MLR was down a surprising one hundred tenbps .

Lastly, the quality of the report was somewhat mixed after a very strong oneQfifteen, with healthcare payables rising slightly more than premiums sequentially, but cash flow coming at just above seventy six percent of net income .
ACTIONS: With the quarter, we are increasing our EPS estimates for two thousand fifteen and two thousand sixteen and increasing our price target.
Our new twelve month price target of dollar one hundred fifty six represents a target multiple of seventeenx our two thousand sixteen cash EPS estimate of dollar nine.twenty.

Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.

The company's limited exposure to individual and small group markets leave it relatively less exposed to the minimum MLR rule.
Cigna is also expanding into international markets, a future area of less regulated growth.
Aspects of health reform are less onerous than expected, membership growth is stronger than projected, and the company can reduce its administrative cost ratio.
along with ten percent upside to estimates brings valuation to dollar one hundred seventy.
Utilization and cost trends accelerate, market declines pressure various aspects of the balance sheet, and Cigna is unable to improve its relative cost structure.

Last week, Cigna pre announced second quarter results and updated guidance with the sale to Anthem.
With that, only major changes in the underlying metrics, or surprises in the quality metrics would have a material impact on the stock.
We see little evidence of any meaningful changes from previous expectations and in fact would suggest that the underlying metrics and quality of the quarter appear relatively strong.
We would suggest that core earnings were slightly above expectations and certain one time positives pushed the results further above our estimates.

One clear area of focus is medical loss ratios and the ratios for both commercial and government segments were down more than one hundredbps from the prior year, a very welcome reversal of the pressure seen last quarter.
As noted last week, guidance is moving up another dollar .ten
dollar .fifteen per share to a new range of dollar eight.thirty
dollar eight.sixty per share, with the midpoint of dollar eight.forty
The boost appears to be driven by mostly by favorable development in the healthcare segment.

In terms of the actual second quarter of two thousand fifteen, Cigna continued the trend of favorable earnings reports for managed care companies with a strong second quarter that was augmented by certain favorable items, and backed by solid quality metrics.
Cigna reported adjusted earnings per share that were safely above our estimates, and the street consensus .
The upside was driven mainly by the healthcare segment which included some favorable development with the other segments also coming in slightly favorable to our estimates.
The commercial MLR trend was down one hundred fortybps in the quarter, and the government MLR was down a surprising one hundred tenbps .

Lastly, we note that the quality of the report was somewhat mixed after a very strong oneQfifteen, with healthcare payables rising slightly more than premiums sequentially, but cash flow coming at just above seventy six percent of net income.
Looking at the quarter, adjusted operating EPS were reported at dollar two.fifty five after a series of adjustments.
First, the quarterly results exclude realized gains of dollar thirteen million, or dollar .five per share.
Second, Cigna recorded a charge of dollar sixty fivemm, or dollar .twenty
On top of those explicit adjustments, the company also recorded another dollar nineteen million, or dollar .seven per share, in favorable development in the healthcare segment.
Cigna also broke out a dollar twenty million, or dollar .eight per share, benefit from a true up on the three Rs.
As a reminder, Cigna excludes development from their guidance and we do not forecast the amounts in our estimates.

With that, we see the adjusted EPS as a true run rate result at dollar two.forty per share, which is safely above our estimate of dollar two.twenty per share and the Street consensus of dollar two.thirty one per share.
We also note that the company alluded to favorable reserve study releases of dollar thirty seven million in the Disability and Life segment, though those tend to recur often .
Global Healthcare segment earnings were above our estimates even when excluding the favorable development and three Rs benefit.
Global Healthcare segment earnings came in at dollar five hundred twenty eight million, up dollar one hundred million, or twenty three.four
As mentioned above, there was dollar nineteen million of favorable PPRD in the quarter and a dollar twenty million benefit from the three Rs.
Excluding those two items, healthcare segment earnings still came in at dollar four hundred eighty nine million, well above our estimate of dollar four hundred thirty nine million.
Moving to loss ratios, the company reported a decrease of one hundred fortybps in the U.S. commercial segment and a decrease of one hundred tenbps in the Government segment.
As a reminder, the commercial MLR was up fortybps YOY in the first quarter, and was also up
Barclays | CIGNA Corp. thirtybps for all of two thousand fourteen.
That said, we estimate that the true up for the three Rs reduced the MLR by about eightybps suggesting that core loss ratio would have been down about sixtybps.
The Government MLR, which includes MA, Medicaid and PDP, was reported to be down one hundred tenbps from the prior year and is similarly a nice reversal from the prior quarter .
The MA MLR improved a total of one hundred thirtybps in two thousand fourteen.
Lastly, total reported global healthcare membership came in at fourteen.seven
hundred seventy one million lives, up one hundred seventeenK lives or .eight
We note that the upside in membership was all in the commercial segment.
Moving to two thousand fifteen guidance, which is wholly consistent with the pre announcement on July twenty four, Cigna is raising full year guidance by dollar .ten
dollar .fifteen per share to a new range of dollar eight.thirty
dollar eight.sixty per share, with the midpoint of dollar eight.forty
five per share compares to our estimate of dollar eight.thirty

Cigna's updated outlook for full year two thousand fifteen consolidated adjusted income from operations is now in the range of dollar two.sixteen­ dollar two.twenty four billion, or dollar eight.thirty­
It should be noted Cigna's outlook excludes the potential effects of future capital deployment.
The updated two thousand fifteen EPS range would imply growth of dollar .forty
six per share, or six percent ten percent over two thousand fourteen results.
In terms of the metrics, Cigna reported improved two thousand fifteen outlook for almost every metric.

Healthcare segment earnings are expected to be dollar thirty dollar forty million higher which is consistent with the favorable development and three R's benefit that aggregated dollar thirty nine million in the second quarter.
With that, the global healthcare segment is now expected to earn dollar one.seventy
three billion which would imply growth of nine percent eleven percent in two thousand fifteen .
Global supplemental benefit income increased by dollar ten million to dollar two hundred forty dollar two hundred sixty million.
In additional, the commercial MLR is projected to be fiftybps lower at seventy seven.five
In summary, Cigna reported an adjusted EPS number in twoQfifteen that was safely above our estimate and the consensus prior to the pre announcement of earnings and announced sale to Anthem last week.
We see nothing in the release that is materially different than expectations.
The quality and MLRs in the quarter were solid and should provide some support.
With the quarter, we are increasing our EPS estimates for two thousand fifteen and two thousand sixteen as well as increasing our price target to reflect the pending sale to Anthem.
Our two thousand fifteen EPS estimate increases to dollar eight.thirteen on a GAAP basis, up from the previous estimate of dollar seven.ninety
Our two thousand fifteen cash EPS estimate goes to dollar eight.fifty from dollar eight.thirty
Next, our two thousand sixteen GAAP EPS increases to dollar eight.ninety, up from dollar eight.fifty
Additionally, our two thousand sixteen cash EPS estimate goes to dollar nine.twenty from dollar eight.ninety.

In light of the announced sale to Anthem as well as the increase in guidance, we are increasing our price target to dollar one hundred fifty six from our previous price target of dollar one hundred thirty seven.
Our twelve month price target of dollar one hundred fifty six represents a target multiple of seventeenx our two thousand sixteen cash EPS estimate of dollar nine.twenty.
Our previous price target of dollar one hundred thirty seven represented a target multiple of fifteenx our two thousand sixteen cash EPS estimate of dollar eight.ninety.
Our new price target reflects the higher multiple the market is assigning to Cigna based on the pending merger with Anthem.
five per share compares to our estimate of dollar eight.thirty
Cigna projects earnings from the Global Health Care segment to be a range of dollar one.seventy
three billion up from its previous guidance range of dollar one.seventy
The updated guidance range also implies nine percent eleven percent growth Y/Y.

However, the two thousand fifteen range eliminates approximately dollar eighty five million in amortization expenses and has been aided by favourable prior period development of dollar forty four YTD.
Also, two thousand fourteen earnings were aided by favourable prior period development of dollar fifty three million .
When we adjust both two thousand fourteen and two thousand fifteen for those changes, the healthcare segment is expected to grow earnings approximately eight.three

Segment Impact two thousand fourteen Global Healthcare Operating Earnings Favorable Development Healthcare two thousand fourteen GHC Adjusted run rate earnings two thousand fifteen Global Healthcare Operating Earnings Acquisition related amortizaton Favorable Development Healthcare YTD two thousand fifteen GHC Adjusted run rate earnings percent Organic Growth
EPS Impact dollar six.thirteen dollar five.ninety three dollar seven.

Cigna increased its earnings guidance for the Global Supplemental Benefits segment by dollar ten million from dollar two hundred thirty dollar two hundred fifty million to dollar two hundred forty dollar two hundred sixty million, representing y/y growth of twenty four percent at the midpoint and reflects the benefit of the company's focus on leveraging its analytic and customer insight capabilities.

The company also maintained its guidance for Group Disability and Life business in the range of dollar three hundred twenty dollar three hundred forty million, which reflects a decrease of four percent at the midpoint.
Lastly, Cigna maintained their expectation to grow medical membership of two percent four.
When we put it all together, Cigna is guiding to operating earnings growth of what we estimate to be six.six

In terms of expenses, as a reminder the company changed their reporting methodology and now provides MLRs on the basis of commercial and total commercial.

Barclays | CIGNA Corp. commercial ratio encompasses all of the commercial risk products including medical, pharmacy dental, stop loss and behavioural products provided through guaranteed cost or experience rated funding arrangements in both the United States and Internationally.
The total government ratio includes Medicare Advantage, Medicare Part D and Medicaid.
The company updated their commercial MLR guidance, which is now projected to be fiftybps lower at seventy seven.five
In the release, Cigna noted the MLR improvement was driven by low utilization, effective medical cost management especially in the medical and specialty results.
In addition, twoQfifteen results benefitted from ~ dollar twenty million related to the update of the two thousand fourteen risk mitigation programs for their Individual business.
The government MLR is still expected to come in between eighty four.five
percent, which is seventy bps above the two thousand fourteen result at the midpoint.
The increase is expected to come partially as a result from specialty drug costs and increased utilization.
The two thousand fifteen projection excludes the impact of prior period development and future share repurchases.
Barclays | CIGNA Corp. utilization and higher costs in the Medicaid business as the company added two new contracts.
Guaranteed Cost Premiums Segment Medical Expense MLR Incremental three R Accrual Incremental three R Accrual MLR Excluding Accrual three R Impact to MLR
In addition, earlier this month, CMS released a report detailing the estimated reinsurance and risk adjustment payments for the FYtwo thousand fourteen benefit year.
We expect CMS to release information related to the risk corridor program later this year .
Without the risk corridor payment information from CMS it is impossible to tell if the companies in our coverage universe were over/under accrued in totality.

Barclays | CIGNA Corp. cannot directly compare Cigna's previous guidance of a dollar two hundred million, Cigna has a dollar three hundred ten.nine million receivable balance from reinsurance and risk corridors.
This implies they are expecting a ~ dollar one hundred million payment related to the risk corridor program.
four) Cigna no longer reports is commercial guaranteed cost MLR, which makes results incomparable to peers.

As mentioned above, Cigna no longer breaks out its guaranteed cost MLR and instead reports a consolidated commercial MLR, which includes its international business segment, stop loss products associated with experience rated customers and other benefits like Dental.
The new reporting methodology obfuscates the core commercial MLR trend, making a comparison to peers apples and oranges.
All of that said, Cigna showed an improvement in their overall commercial MLR and reduced their two thousand fifteen guidance for commercial MLRs by fiftybps.
This trend is consistent with peers who have also shown annual improvement in commercial MLRs this quarter.
For some background, last quarter's results Cigna's reported commercial MLR was below the peer group average.
In oneQfifteen Cigna's commercial MLR was up thirty onebps y/y but decreased by six hundred seventy ninebps on a sequential basis.
In fourQfourteen Cigna's commercial MLR was flat y/y but increased by five hundred eightybps on a sequential basis.

In threeQfourteen quarter commercial MLR declined by two hundred tenbps y/y and two hundred thirtybps sequentially, after increasing four hundred fortybps y/y and seven hundredbps sequentially in the second quarter.
Taking a step back, Cigna's commercial cost trends, have come in all over the map in recent quarters.
For the thirteen quarters from oneQone hundred twenty twoQfifteen, Cigna's commercial MLR ran an average of three hundred twenty sevenbps below its peer group.
More recently, in twoQfourteen, the elevated costs resumed, with commercial MLR increasing four hundred fortybps y/y and seven hundredbps sequentially.
However, trends have improved again this quarter, with a commercial MLR improving one hundred forty threebps y/y.
Aetna Anthem Cigna Health Net Humana UnitedHealth Commercial YOY Change CI vs. Average
Note: Aetna and Health Net have yet to report twoQfifteen results, figures represent Barclays estimates.
For full year two thousand fourteen, Cigna recorded dollar fifty three million in segment favorable development related to prior periods.
For reference, Cigna reported dollar seventy seven million in PPRD for the full year two thousand thirteen, and dollar sixty six million in two thousand twelve.

The company recently collapsed some of the International membership into the ASO category so the overall numbers can be misleading with regards to the domestic changes.
In the second quarter of two thousand fifteen, the company gained one hundred seventeenK total medical lives q/q, with a twenty oneK gain in the US overall.
As noted, Cigna saw a decrease in its Commercial risk membership with tenK losses .
However, Cigna saw a strong sequential increase in commercial ASO up one hundred twenty sixK lives q/q and a slight dip in Medicaid.
US Risk International Risk Total Risk US Service International Service Total Service US Total International Total Total Commercial Medicare Medicaid Total Cigna
In two thousand fourteen, Cigna's medical customers grew by one.seven
percent within the company's guidance range of one two percent when adjusted for the cessation of its limited benefits business.
Back in threeQthirteen Cigna outlined an expectation that the U.S. national account market would decline in population by one percent to two percent, but planned to continue efforts take share.

Looking ahead, Cigna expects its medical membership to grow by two percent four percent, driven by growth in commercial, as well as mid to upper single digit growth in the Medicare, partially offset by some expected reduction in our non ACA compliant individual customers.
From two thousand one through two thousand six, Cigna saw its membership share relative to the other three large national plans shrink.
Cigna lost over four.one million lives over that six year period on an organic basis.

For some comparison, on an organic basis, Aetna lost just two.eight million lives from two thousand one to two thousand six, while United added two.three million lives and WellPoint added eight.two million.

All of that said, in two thousand seven Cigna experienced commercial growth of three hundred ninety sixK lives on an organic basis, beating UnitedHealth and coming relatively close to WellPoint on a percentage basis.
For two thousand eight, we saw a loss of two hundred fifty fourK lives organically .
In terms of two thousand nine, overall medical membership declined by six hundred fifty sixK lives from year end two thousand eight totals.
In two thousand ten, Cigna outpaced its peers, with risk membership increasing two hundred sixty fourK lives and ASO lives up fortyK.
In two thousand eleven, the company gained two hundred eighty fourK ASO lives, offset by losses of one hundred thirty sevenK risk members.
This is below UnitedHealth and WellPoint, but better than the results at Aetna.
In two thousand twelve, we estimate that the company added eight hundred eightyK new commercial lives, most of which was organic adds.
In two thousand fourteen, Cigna added one hundred ninetyK total lives.
A few notes about the data used below: one) this represents organic enrolment changes only.
We have excluded more than twenty separate acquisitions for these companies.
four) We simply combined legacy WellPoint and Anthem for the Pro Forma version of the company.

The company ended the quarter with dollar five hundred sixty million of cash at the parent.
The twoQfifteen balance includes proceeds from the recent issuance of long term debt, which was used to redeem existing debt in twoQfifteen.

In two thousand fourteen the company contributed dollar one hundred thirteen million towards funding its pension, a notable reduction from prior years which is expected to free up additional capital for shareholders.
Cigna's capital deployment strategy remains unchanged, in the following order: one.
M and A to acquire capabilities and scale, mainly tuck in acquisitions.
The company offered some interesting commentary on M and A priorities.
Namely, Cigna highlighted international assets, capabilities around U.S. seniors and dual eligibles and retail based capabilities as target areas for future acquisitions.
nine) We review what we believe to be Cigna's administrative costs relative to its peer group.

For two thousand fifteen, Cigna anticipates the operating expense ratio to decrease ~ one hundred bps to twenty one percent twenty two percent, which includes a one hundred tenbps impact from the HIF.
It also excludes any acquisition related amortization expenses in the Global Healthcare segment.
On a consolidated basis, Cigna continues to run a higher administrative cost ratio than its peers.
Cigna has spent significant amounts of capital on systems and infrastructure over
In fact, the company has spent more than dollar four.one billion in capital expenditures since the beginning of two thousand.
On top of that investment spending, the company has taken a series of operational changes in an effort to right size its infrastructure.
Over the past several years that spending has reaped little discernible benefit, in our opinion.

At this point, we believe that the company's smaller size relative to national competitors, the uniqueness of certain product lines and International exposure create a higher overall administrative cost structure on a relative basis.
The chart below simply shows total administrative costs, total membership and then the ratio.
That said, we believe that the chart is telling at a minimum from a directional standpoint.
Among the national plans, Cigna had the highest overall administrative cost per member month by a wide margin at an estimated dollar forty one.eight
We anticipate this competitive disadvantage to persist in two thousand fifteen.

However, it is important to note that when comparing only Cigna's global healthcare segment which is more representative of a traditional managed care business to its smaller competitors, administrative costs appear more in line with the group.

When looking at the global healthcare segment only, Cigna's administrative expenses on a PMPM basis drop substantially, to dollar thirty two.one in two thousand fourteen, which compares to the commercial average of dollar thirty four.fourteen.

Although this is clearly more representative of the traditional insurance business within Cigna, it's still not a true apples to apples comparison, as the other national names have a multitude of non healthcare insurance businesses as well.
In two thousand fifteen, we estimate Cigna will have an estimated overall administrative cost per member per month of dollar forty one.thirty
This compares to our estimate of dollar thirty six.eighteen for the overall group in two thousand fifteen.
All of that said, the data below suggest that on a fully consolidated basis Cigna has less operating leverage than its peers.

Cigna also updated the amount of loans that were considered problem loans or potential problem loans in the quarter.
These are loans where the company believes that there is some risk to cash flow of these mortgages in the future.
Barclays | CIGNA Corp. were dollar one hundred four million of mortgages classified as problem mortgages, five.one
percent of the total, and down one hundred sixty bps sequentially.
Problem and potential problem mortgages were listed at between dollar sixty nine million and dollar ninety three million from two thousand seven through the end of two thousand eight.
Another dollar sixty four million loan was moved into that category in the first quarter of two thousand nine, bringing the balance to four.one percent of the commercial mortgage total.
In the second quarter of two thousand nine, we saw a large increase with dollar three hundred twenty one million, or nine percent of the total, now listed as problem bonds.
With the third quarter of two thousand nine, we again saw an increase in problem mortgages, which increased to nine.five percent of the total cost.
The trend continued in the fourth quarter, with dollar three hundred ninety seven million or eleven.three
Cigna has slowly lowered its exposure to problem bonds through twoQfifteen.
As a percent of total cost, problem bonds accounted for five.one
percent, which is down from eight.two percent in oneQfourteen, the lowest it has been since oneQnine.

In December two thousand ten we launched the Raskin Index of Sustainable Quality Earnings .
RISQE is an analytical tool to objectively evaluate the quality of our coverage universe's quarterly earnings.
The model uses quantitative metrics to produce a ratings score for each company, with high scores indicating a lower level of risk to future results.
RISQE scores range from one to one hundred, with one hundred reflecting the highest level of sustainable quality earnings.
Overall, Cigna's RISQE score for the quarter was seventy four.seven
Improvement in the balance sheet metric and income statement metric was offset by slight deterioration in the cash flow statement metrics.
The balance sheet RISQE score increased by two hundred fifty six bps to twenty one.two
The income statement RISQE score increased one thousand two hundred ninety bps sequentially to twenty three.
percent, as the company's MLR decreased by one hundred elevenbps y/y.
Finally, the cash flow RISQE score decreased two hundred fiftybps sequentially to eleven.five
percent, driven by an annual decline in TTM CFFO of fourteen.

In situations where the RISQE score moves more than would be indicated by a ninety percent confidence level away from its historic averages and there is support from more than one component, we have seen very high correlation with forward stock movements.
In this situation, the change in quarterly RISQE score and supporting components was not great enough to qualify as a significant event.
Total global healthcare revenues were up ten.two percent Y/Y to dollar seven.five billion.
In the release, Cigna said the results are driven by rate actions, specialty contributions and customer growth in its Commercial and Government business.
Total premiums and fees for the segment were dollar six.seven billion, up ten.one percent y/y.
percent Y/Y in twoQfifteen to dollar six hundred twenty five million.
percent from the prior year quarter to dollar fifty seven million.
In twoQfifteen, the segment also benefited from dollar nineteen million in after tax favorable PPRD, compared to dollar sixteen million in twoQfourteen.
Total Global Supplemental Benefits Revenues were dollar seven hundred eighty two million, up three.three
In the press release, Cigna said the results reflect customer growth and strong retention.
Total Group Disability and Life revenues were up six.six percent Y/Y to dollar one thousand thirty nine million.
Total Disability and Life operating income was dollar one hundred six million, down three.six
percent from the prior year quarter, representing a ten.two percent operating margin.
This compares to an operating income of dollar fifty one million last quarter.
This segment represents amortized gains and annuity business as well as the company's corporate life insurance business and the run off retirement segment.
Total segment revenue was dollar one hundred nineteen million in the quarter, down four.eight
The company reported an Operating earnings outflow of dollar forty seven million, up nine.three
Additionally, Medicare Part D membership totalled one.five million lives, up twenty.seven
Medicare and Medicaid membership grew by seventy oneK Y/Y, increased .two
Finally, international risk lives increased thirty fourK lives y/y, flat q/q, and came in seven.fourK
percent, down one hundred eight bps from the prior year, and down sixty ninebps sequentially.
The result was two hundred thirteen bps below our MLR estimate of eighty two.thirty
Revenue from premiums and fees of dollar eight.five billion were up nine.four
percent year over year to dollar two hundred ninety seven million, one.five
percent of revenues, down one hundred fifty two bps y/y, and were one hundred five bps below our estimates.
The number of shares outstanding came in at two hundred sixty one million, down eleven.fiveK

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.

Valuation Methodology: Our twelve month price target of dollar one hundred fifty six represents a target multiple of one hundred seventeen.x
our two thousand sixteen Cash EPS estimate of dollar eight.ninety per share.
Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Price Target: one) As the company reprices its unprofitable health care book, it loses large blocks of membership.
We believe that CIGNA will need to reinvigorate growth to see earnings improve.
two) The substantial spending on the transformation project will likely continue to pressure earnings.
four) CIGNA's nonhealth businesses have been somewhat spotty in performance and perform worse in a slower economy.
five) While likely not imminent, CIGNA is a natural candidate for future bidding on health plan assets up for sale.
six) There is and could continue to be near term negative sentiment toward managed care companies and concern about industry pricing trends and potential litigation noise.
